fields.name: Hatty Stewart
fields.description:
Hatty is a London-based artist and
illustrator with a varied portfolio. With a vibrant,
tongue in cheek visual identity, she is a self-
proclaimed ‘professional doodler’ with a unique and
playful illustration style that extends itself through
the worlds of advertising, animation, art and fashion.

Clients include Gucci, Apple, Lotte, The New York
Times, Estee Lauder, MAC, Samsung, Google,
Adidas, Wacom, Tommy Hilfiger and more.

fields.name: Mary Fare
fields.description:
Specialising in character design, bold colours and
graphic compositions, French Artist & Illustrator
Mary aspires to create artwork that
invokes joy with her cheeky and playful style.

With the intention of tackling the issues she cares
about, Mary’s career has seen her working on
many personal and collaborative projects with
global brands that focus on social or ethical causes.

Previous clients include Nike, Kiehl’s, Levis, Adidas,
Volkswagen, Kipling, Netflix, Apple, Spotify, Youtube
and many more

fields.name: Jasmine Sera
fields.description:
Jasmine is a freelance illustrator and designer
passionate about identity, empowerment, self-love
and positivity through her artwork. Her love for
vintage graphics, nature, bold typography
reminiscent of vintage film posters and cassette
tapes, have formed her colourful visual identity in
illustration, typography and design.

She has worked with a diverse roster of global
clients specialising in illustration, murals, painting,
design, typography, hand lettering, creative
workshops, 3D animation, product and apparel
design, engraving, bespoke hand-painted
customised products, live art and branded event
activations.

As a believer to use her creativity to unite and
inspire, she has also held creative workshops and
has been a speaker in talks and festivals as well as
being the face of global branded campaigns.

Her work has been championed by platforms
including Vice, D&AD, Hype Beast, It’s Nice That,
Creative Review, gal-dem, Stylist, Mass Appeal and
more.

fields.name: Tom&Ink
fields.description:
TOM&INK is a London based illustrator and author
who creates work that makes you feel empowered,
confident and all warm and fuzzy inside. Recurring
themes in their work are LGBTQ+ rights, mental
health awareness, body positivity and drag.

Tom has released two books, ‘Free To Be Me' an
LGBTQ+ journal of Love, Pride and Finding Your
Inner Rainbow, published by Penguin Random
House UK and ‘Queer Power’, an illustrated journal
of LGBTQ+ icons, activists and game changers from
across the rainbow.

Tom is currently working on their upcoming young
adult graphic novel, ‘Queens of the Crypt’ - Also to
be published by Penguin.

Tom’s client list includes Little Mix, Cheryl, The X-
Factor, Selfridges, Skinny Dip, Emma Watson’s ‘Our
Shared Shelf’ and more. They are also the official
illustrator Ru Paul’s Drag Race UK.

Tom has also been lucky enough to be feature in
Cosmopolitan, Gay Times, Glamour, Buzzfeed and
Time Out.

fields.name: Muragih
fields.description:
Murgih is a multi-disciplinary artist, illustrator &
designer working in London.

Using a colourfully surreal visual aesthetic he
playfully explores the macabre and bittersweet
experience of his daily life & identity.

Infused with candy coated dreams and peppered
with South Asian motifs, his work - encompassing
film, architecture, art & design - resonates with
those also seeking kindness, authenticity &
compassion.

fields.name: Anna Kilpelain
fields.description:
Anna is a Finnish born illustrator who
lives and works in London. A graduate of London
Collect of Communication, Anna’s portfolio bursts
with character depicting summery scenes of urban
landscapes, the energy of the city, pattern, portraits
and narrative with a distinctly tropical vibe.

Her work has appeared in magazines such as The
Gourmand, Lucky Peach and Yen and her vivid
patterns can be found on anything from book covers
to blankets and skateboards - collaborating with
brands such as Samsung, Barbie, Levis and Haagen
Dazs to name a few.

Inspired by stills, Anna’s illustrations exist somewhere
between a comic and a painting. Her feel-good
aesthetic and flirtatious scenes are inherently
euphoric, while her confident use of lurid rich colours
embraces the extravagance of youth.
